website_summaries.verdict: The TiVo Roamio is hands-down the best DVR for recording over-the-air TV, but its excellence comes at a great cost.
pros: The TiVo Roamio is an exceptionally polished DVR for recording free over-the-air TV
The interface is excellent and intuitive, making it dead simple to record shows and series exactly the way you'd like
There's built-in Wi-Fi and a 500GB hard drive
The remote is excellent and works via RF, so you can hide the box behind a cabinet
And the hardware itself is compact, sleek and silent
cons: It's very expensive when you add in subscription costs
Only the entry-level Roamio records over-the-air TV, and it lacks the step-up features of more expensive models
And there should be more streaming services at this price, like HBO Go, Vudu, and a fully-functioning Amazon Instant app

customer_reviews.title: Beware buying a used Roamio
customer_reviews.text: My Roamio had to go in for repairs-I couldn't bare to be without one for 2 weeks. I ordered a used one thinking I woud sell it when I got done with it. I did not realize until I went to set it up that Tivo doesn't let the "no service pan required for a Roamio" continue when you buy it used. I have just lost all respect for the Tivo company. I will pay the $14.99 for the month I need this one and when I have to replace the ne that is getting repaired- it probably will not be a Tivo product
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Horribly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on advice of a friend who swears by it. I have tried for weeks to get this thing to initialize and bring in at least one cable channel ... without success. While pondering whether to send this back to Amazon or not I instead I waited for my friend to visit and listen to his sage advice. His experience was totally unlike mine as he never had a problem setting his unit up and had never encountered any of the issues I am having. I hate it when a piece of consumer electronics gets the best of me, which is extremely rare, but this TiVo Romaio 500 GB DVR seems to have accomplished precisely that.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize I would have to purchase a subscription from Tivo to use this. ($149.00) a year. I am having trouble setting it up. I would get another model that includes a subscription with your purchase. Hopefully the newer model is easier to setup. Later I was told by Comcast that they do not sell self install kits for the cable card. they charged $70 to send a technician out to deliver and install the card. Then they charge $9.95 per month to rent the card. At this point, I wish I had never gotten involved with the Tivo, but due to the long time that it took to accomplish the install, I cannot return it.
customer_reviews.author: Carole S

customer_reviews.title: TiVo freed us from cable!
customer_reviews.text: We were paying $110 to a brand name TV provider for years, more for the 6 months with Sports Ticket payments. First TiVo Premiere and now TiVo Roamio changed all that. We use an antenna to get OTA channels and bought a lifetime subscription to TiVo programming. We can record our favorite shows effortlessly, just like before, but no high monthly bill. True I no longer see every Patriots football game, but we get a lot of them OTA. Combined with Netflix & Amazon, we still have more TV programs then we can possibly watch. We even got a TiVo for our in-laws! We are HUGE TiVo fans - thanks for providing a reasonable alternative to expensive providers!
customer_reviews.author: Chicksy

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from Roamio is a pain
customer_reviews.text: As usual, getting a Tivo to activate is an exercise in frustration and the Bolt is no exception. It is extra frustrating if you're trying to upgrade from a previous Tivo. Basically, there is no "I'm replacing my old Roamio with a Bolt" option. You have to subscribe the Bolt with a new contract as if you're a new customer. Any subscription time you have left on your old Roamio is forfeit. Also it will be a couple of days before the new Bolt is fully synchronized and apps are set up so expect some downtime. You'd think Tivo would have their act together by now.
customer_reviews.author: I. East

customer_reviews.title: Product works great setup is painfully slow
customer_reviews.text: The product works great with my HD outside antenna. Once it's setup it's a good product. However the TIVO company as nice as customer service is makes it painfully slow to get started. First you have to activate the box on their site with a credit card. Then it take 2 to 24 hours for it to activate. After setting it aside for 2 days and once it's connected to the internet it take more than an hour on a fast internet connection to upload the schedule and software updates. Customer service at Tivo cannot answer why it can take up to 24 hours to active and that's unheard of it todays want it in an instant world.
customer_reviews.author: Justthefacts

customer_reviews.title: Cut the cable!!
customer_reviews.text: I resisted dumping my cable because I didn't want to give up my DVR. I have heard about TIVO for years, but didn't know it would work with a roof antenna until recently. It solved my hesitation and I "cut the cable" right away. I now use my roof antenna (it is amazing how many channels are out there for free) for local channels and supplement with Netflix and Amazon Instant. BTW, the free airwaves are all HD. This device makes it all so easy - with a click of a button I can switch from the roof antenna to Amazon Instant. Wish I had done this a few years ago!
customer_reviews.author: travelingbean

customer_reviews.title: Loyal Tivo customer
customer_reviews.text: I've been with Tivo since the very beginning and have purchase most of the updates over the years. This is a nice product. Trim, light...they get better each time. But....if you have an old, out-of-date cable provider as we have in southeastern New Mexico, remember that this device ONLY picks up digital signals....so it must have a cable card from your cable company and THEN will only pick up digital signals. If your system still broadcasts many channels that haven't been updated to digital---you're out of luck. Looks like I'll have to keep my old one also. But that isn't Tivo's fault. Once again, it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: 1Pilgrim

customer_reviews.title: Neatest thing since sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: Neatest thing since sliced bread! In a week we'll have been on this box for 1 1/2 years. Can't beat the simplicity and the connectivity. It records off the antenna in the best HD I've ever seen and now the menu shows where streaming video of our shows can be found if we are looking for more. The convenience of having our Amazon Prime, Netflix, and Hulu so accessible and easily navigable on he same remote means no confusing stumbles among one or more extra remotes. That's all I got. We're never disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dougie

customer_reviews.title: Love this device
customer_reviews.text: Love this device! When Aereo got cancelled I looked for other ways to get the major channels without paying for cable. I purchased a Mohu Curve antenna which gives me all the major channels in HD. But I still wanted a DVR to record all my shows. After some research, I decided to try the TiVo Roamio. It's awesome! I can also access Amazon Prime, Netflix, Hulu Plus etc... with it, but I prefer to use my Roku device which seams easier to navigate for those channels. The set-up on this device is super easy. I'm extremely happy AND I'm saving tons of money in comparison to what I use to pay for cable.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppergal70

customer_reviews.title: I love my TiVo for many reasons.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fan for three years last Dec. I record everything. Any problems have been the networks. I have The Stream. Bought it for my iPad. I had a minor problem with it overheating until I finally realized I needed to blow the dust out just like with a PC. This last Dec. I bought a Roamio and a Mini for my bedroom TV. I have never been disappointed. But one of the VERY BEST things about TiVo is the Customer Service. I am 78, i can read and follow directions. But sometimes I really appreciate the helpful people walking me through something. A very good crew and that alone makes TiVo stand out.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya

customer_reviews.title: Interface is great
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Tivo subscriber since Tivo first started with a few Series 1 boxes and when very few people even knew what a DVR was. I've had 10+ Tivo's through the years and the evolution of the box has been great. The addition of multiple tuners, multi-room viewing, external application support such as Netflix and more recently, the ability to use a CableCard and access Xfinity on-demand are great selling points compared to a high end CATV settop box. The interface is beautiful and easy to use and is something that makes my television viewing experience so much more pleasurable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: It seems you have to go online to get the information you need which is alright but it would be better if you just include it wi
customer_reviews.text: The DVR player works OK but came with little information. I am not the most savvy person when it comes to electronics but there isn't even a description as to what the lights on the front of the unit are for. It seems you have to go online to get the information you need which is alright but it would be better if you just include it with the product. I also feel that the menu is not as user friendly as it could be. It seems rather poorly designed as compared to Direct TV and their menu system.Perhaps I just need to get used to the operating system.
customer_reviews.author: Darla Kinsella

customer_reviews.title: New TiVo is the best one yet.
customer_reviews.text: Compact but more powerful than previous generations of TiVo. Can record up to 4 shows at the same time and can see other TiVos in the house. If you have a 4th generation TiVo premiere or another Roamio in the house they will see each other and can share recorded programs. You can watch a show from one TiVo on another or transfer a recorded show or movie to another TiVo. The Roamio has quick response times and a lot of content options. Recommended if you record a lot of shows and have a large family with several members wanting to record their favorites at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus Brown

customer_reviews.title: Tivo for OTA
customer_reviews.text: I have been using TIVO for OTA use in Canada and am pretty happy with it overall Pros: Interface is much better than other over OTA pvrs and is very well polished Tuners are acceptable even when splitting the signal between several recordings The set up process was pretty intuitive The tech support system is great Cons: The monthly cost or life time subscription fee. Adding insult to injury are the advertisements which continually show in the banner The applications available are limited compared to an option like ROKU I have given the TIVO 5 stars as it does everything I wanted to and surpassed my expectations although it is not without flaws
customer_reviews.author: Outdoors Business Guy

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. I have had it now for a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I have had it now for a few months. It enabled me to "cut the cord" from the cable/satellite companies. With one of the new flat over the air (OTA) antennas, I get most of the channels that we watched anyway, and at better quality than I was getting from DirecTV. While I do pay about $5/month for the TiVo subscription, it is very worth having the directory and schedule of shows on-line. All the features of recording are available here for this low low cost. Highly recommend going this route. I'm saving hundreds of dollars a year.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: worth it and easy to use..
customer_reviews.text: cut the cord about 2 years ago.. get about 18 channels over the air in WNC,, never really watched tv since, due to time constraints and 12 hour shifts.. now can 'tape' tv shows and have a sampling of what TiVo recommends also.. glad you can now pay the 150 a year rather than the 15 a month.. easy to fast forward, delete and undelete if my wife wants.. well worth the cost.. now we want to improve our antenna to get more options.. the TiVo tapes stuff randomly at times and fun to fast forward through some odd stuff..
customer_reviews.author: Kilu

customer_reviews.title: Buy this if you want to cut the cord with cable TV.  It works.
customer_reviews.text: This TiVo is the core product allowing me to become cable television free with roughly a $150 savings each month on my cable bill. My model connects to an antenna for terrific over-the-air HD signals that are a breeze to record. The quality appears to me to be at least as good as my old cable signal. The only downside is that I need to rely on Netflex, Amazon Prime and Apple TV for cable shows and movies. The subscription fees for these, combined with a liberal use of ala carte pay-to-view content is still far, far less than what cable was costing me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Larsen

customer_reviews.title: TiVo is so easy to use - we've tried other DVRs and we came back to TiVo and we're staying!
customer_reviews.text: We love being able to pause live TV shows when we get a phone call, rewind when we miss something that was said and we love being able to record shows while we're watching another channel or another recorded show. Can't watch TV now without TiVo! We've tried at least two other non-TiVo DVRs, and we came running back to the ease of use and reliability of TiVo! With our Roamio, you can record up to 4 shows at once and also be watching a recorded show. Roamio is also much faster in responding to the remote control and it doesn't require an external wireless antenna. LOVE TiVo.
customer_reviews.author: Dan in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Use it all the time for recording, Netflix, Amazon, etc
customer_reviews.text: No need for “smart TV” with this thing. Has Amazon, Netflix and many more built in plus the recording works very well. The iPhone app is very nice for remote scheduling of recording. I wish the monthly charge was less (minus a star for that). Also with cable card it eliminates the need for s separate cable box. Overall a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Tivo is your best bet for a cable DVR
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice DVR. It's been in service for 6 months without a glitch. At first I thought the picture quality was not as crisp as it was on my Tivo Premiere, but I've gotten used to it. Because there are 4 tuners vs. 2 in my previous Tivo, the signal strength is around 80 for my main channels, whereas before it was closer to 90. I do like the power save option, not only because of the electricity savings, but also that the hard drive isn't recording 24/7 like on the Premiere. And of course I love the user interface; it really is the best out there. I recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: MisterDJ

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stream HD with wireless!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Nowhere in the product information online or in the box does it warn you that you can't stream in HD over your wireless. This goes for any streaming service (eg--Netflix or amazon prime.) You must use MoCA or an Ethernet connection. Now if you also have a Roku or similar device, you'll be ok, but what a pain. TiVo explained to me over the phone that the problem is the Roamio boxes have too much hardware in one place leading to poor wireless reception, whereas dedicated streaming devices are much simpler, ergo work better.
customer_reviews.author: cyclz

customer_reviews.title: No better DVR... Period
customer_reviews.text: The Roamio HD is a great little DVR. Following on the heals of the series 4. I have both now upgraded to 2TB ea. (and very easy to do on the Raomio). The two complement each other in that the Roamio can record 4 programs at once, and the series 4 has separate tuners for OTA and Cable. The two DVR's are networked and are very fast to transfer programs between devices. Way to go Tivo. Another winner.
customer_reviews.author: glr

customer_reviews.title: Versatility, flexibility and ready information and menus
customer_reviews.text: I have been a TiVo owner and user since 2000. I have owned the original TiVo and have purchased 2 series 2 TiVo boxes. I have recommended and gifted TiVo boxes to others and they have been pleased with the TiVo experience. I currently own a TiVo Roamio and TiVo Mini and have once again, been pleased with the functionality and ease of setup and use. No other DVR can compare to TiVo. I stream my home media using Plex Server. So with online, on-air, cable and home media streaming, I have everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: Walter T.

customer_reviews.title: I love my TiVo's and the Roamio just blows me away
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Roamio, and I don't say the word love easily. 4 tuners, bluetooth remote, and being able to link it with my Premier in another room is just icing on the cake. I can also use it to get the On Demand content from Hulu and Netflicks along with all sorts of other Web based Content including Netcasts from the likes of TWiT.TV and HuffPo, And expanding the storage from the likes of Weaknees or Western Digital is a great addon. I plan on getting TiVo Mini's for the other rooms in the house and getting rid of those pesky cable boxes
customer_reviews.author: TinkerToyTech

customer_reviews.title: First (widely-used) DVR and still the best DVR out there!
customer_reviews.text: I've used several other DVRs, but keep coming back to TIVO every time. No one else is exclusively focused on the DVR, no one else seems to have the experience with designing an intuitive user interface. I've had the misfortune of using Comcast's X1 device due to their initial refusal to supply a cable card for their service. After a couple weeks of irritation I'm finally driving an hour to one of their locations to trade in the X1 for a cable card. I can see why they want to make it difficult for me to use my TIVO instead of their device....the X1 can't compete when there is any choice.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Let's me eliminate high cost cable/satellite TV service
customer_reviews.text: We had Direct TV service, we were paying $120 a month and we needed to cut our overhead. Direct TV was able to reduce the charge by $10 per month but that was it. Decided to leave Direct TV and looked for several alternatives. I read reviews on several different kinds of service and Tivo had what appeared to be the best, and most reasonably priced service. We now own two Tivo boxes and are considering buying a third. Our monthly service fees are now below $30. Life is good with Tivo.
customer_reviews.author: wwireless

customer_reviews.title: Massively flawed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for his birthday. It turned out to be the worst present ever. We weren't crazy about it in the first place because it needed a subscription. The main problem was that it kept glitching in the middle of shows, and customer service was hard to deal with and couldn't make it stop.
customer_reviews.author: Big Wave Betty

customer_reviews.title: Huge upgrade from the Tivo HD.
customer_reviews.text: So far it's a thousand times better than the Tivo HD. It's faster, has more tuners, doesn't fail to record things and is a lot more cute. The remote even workes better. I have tons of shows on there and I'm not even at 50% yet so that's definitely an upgrade. My old HD didn't hold nearly as much as it should have. I really like it and will keep it as long is it will have me! When you activate it search online for coupon codes. They usually have a code for $100 off lifetime service. That's what I'll be doing when my 12 month contract is up.
customer_reviews.author: rayna

customer_reviews.title: Best thing to happen to DVR's EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Won't ever go back to using their cable box. Love my TiVo! Super easy to set up and so user friendly for setting record options. One Pass feature is my fave because it records my show regardless of what night it comes on or what time. Just set it and go! The only it can't do is compensate for delayed start if football game or live event runs over into the preset recording slot. I can live with that. Other than that, it's best thing to happen to DVR's EVER!
customer_reviews.author: DaraLynn

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I do this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Why do I love TIVO: 1. Can record up to four shows simultaneously 2. Intuitive Navigation 3. Easy to set up 4. Fabulous on-line help 5. Get to watch shows when it's convenient for me to watch them 6. Can set up to record the entire season of episodes if that's what I want. 7. Easy to add shows I want to record 8. Easy to remove shows I no longer want to record 9. Get to fast-forward through all those pesky advertisements!!! Enough Said.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda A. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Love TiVo but monthly service pricing seems to be increasing
customer_reviews.text: LOVE TiVo and this is a great product. I have had TiVo's for years and they are by FAR better than any DVR I've gotten from a cable company. Great jump back when skipping through commercials and awesome fast forward and rewind button on the remote to jump ahead or back. The only problem is it seems like TiVo is changing their pricing so Lifetime service is much more expensive than it used to be and they are limiting their multiuser discounts now but I still would rather pay a bit more than use a Cable Company DVR
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't watch TV without my TIVO
customer_reviews.text: We purchased our DirectTV DVR's with TiVo in 2004 and then when DirectTV dropped TiVo we stayed with our old units and wouldn't upgrade because we would lose the TiVo service and we would be forced to use the new DirecTV wanna be a TiVo service. Eventually DirectTV went back to TiVo and we upgraded our units and DirecTV upgraded our monthly cost. We eventually cut the cable and went OTA with TiVo and haven't looked back since. I couldn't watch TV without my TiVo. I will be a customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Lewis

customer_reviews.title: It's so much faster than Comcast & ATT DVRs
customer_reviews.text: We have had both Comcast and ATT Uverse DVRs. They are both painfully slow when changing channels (even the new X1 box) or scrolling through the Guide. In fact, our Uverse DVR had a known bug (ATT confirmed it on the phone with me) that showed programs off by two hours from the time zone I live in. Can you believe it! I missed watching the first two hours of an NFL hame last fall because of it. TiVo is so quick and having MLB TV and Amazon Prime integrated is great. We don't need to switch to the Apple TV or Roku anymore.
customer_reviews.author: heywatchit

customer_reviews.title: Great, But Could Be Better
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the TIVO Roamio is a great DVR. I've been using it for about two weeks. As an Amazon Prime member, it is a shame that TIVO does not currently support Prime video streaming (reason for a four star rather than five star rating). That said, we are really enjoying our Roamio and are liking it a lot. Haven't quite got to the love affair part yet, but getting close.I ordered a breakout cable to connect the Roamio to a DVD recorder. Will see how that works (or doesn't) when I get it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great Device
customer_reviews.text: This device is better than the DVR my cable provider gave me. I like the fact that you can set up wish list recordings, and the way it backs up a bit to stop at the show when fast forwarding through commercials. One thing I'm disappointed in is the fact that you can not access your free amazon prime content. It's a bit misleading when they show the Amazon logo but when you get the TiVo it only has Amazon Instant Video available. This only allows you to purchase stuff to watch. There is no access to all the free amazon prime content.
customer_reviews.author: Woody409

customer_reviews.title: Love the flexiblity of Tivo!
customer_reviews.text: We had an old VCR than burned out after a power surge. We did not have cable and were not able to record shows. I asked a few friends and family and heard that Tivo was a great product. The original purchase was a Tivo Premier so that we could record shows. It gets heavy usage and my mom often runs out of room. I wanted one for my own tv so I recently purchased the Roamio. I'm still new to it but am enjoying it's options and flexibility. The best part is that my Tivo service is cheaper than purchasing a cable package!
customer_reviews.author: Denise K. White

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love with Roamio!
customer_reviews.text: I waited a while to buy another Tivo dvr and Roamio was worth the wait. It was so easy to setup even before the cable card. There was a little hiccup because I had to use a tuner for my extended digital cable channels but an easy fix. I'm really enjoying watching my favorite shows while recording others at the same time, its brilliant. Also great to watch Netflix and Amazon in one simple box and have one remote to control EVERYTHING even my LG tv! When not watching I can just listen to my Pandora music what more could you ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Monie

customer_reviews.title: Good, but underpowered
customer_reviews.text: This is a good unit, but it's underpowered from a processor perspective. With all four tuners recording at once, the functionality of the unit starts to not work or is slow and no-responsive. TiVo software and functionality puts other cable boxes to shame.....not even close. TiVo is always adding functionality and generally the customer support personnel are nice and professional.
customer_reviews.author: ERAU

customer_reviews.title: TiVo Roamio is the Way to Go, if you're patient with setup
customer_reviews.text: It took a few tries to get the cable company to send the right cable card (and to trouble shoot that as an issue when the Roamio was first set up), and entering all the information for various services (on the device, rather than through a browser) is a pain--BUT, once you figure it all out (including sub-optimal meaning system) the Roamio is GREAT. We have AppleTV (b/c we are Mac people who like iTunes and AirPlay) too, and we use both. Between these two devices, you are ALL SET.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: TiVo is so awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how I used to watch tv. Having to pick between two shows because they aired at the same time, missing episodes because of daily tasks or my job or appointments, or shows that were on too late. The dvr platforms that cable companies offers are pathetic. The Roamio is great - so much better to be able to switch between dvr's and the transfer rate is so fast. I've been using TiVo for many years and can't imagine watching tv 'live' ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Lesann

customer_reviews.title: Much Improved
customer_reviews.text: This is far better model than our previous Premier which required an external wifi adapter. The internet apps on the Premiere never worked well enough to be usable. The Roamio with internal wifi works much better and the Netflix and other apps are robust enough to be useful even though we have the same apps available in our Samsung SmartTV. The channel guide and DVR menus are very good in the TiVo and for cord-cutting, this is the best DVR option in my opinion. The only down side is the subscription fee which would be much more tolerable if it was not contracted and customers were allowed to cancel without penalties.
customer_reviews.author: Greg & Linda Zenitsky

customer_reviews.title: Way to go TiVo!
customer_reviews.text: We ditched our cable service to go with the TiVo Roamio and a digital antenna. This is going to save us $100's every year. The Roamio has many more features than the DVR we leased from the cable company and costs us less per month. My wife loves being able to watch Netflix on the TV and we have not been able to even try some of the other services yet. If we decide to get cable for football season, the TiVo Roamio will take care of it for us as well. I can't believe we waited so long to do this. This really does make TV fun again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Parker

customer_reviews.title: Better than Dish DVR
customer_reviews.text: Decided we no longer wanted to pay big bucks to Dish to watch the extreme glut of advertising, "reality" shows, and constant reruns. We do like to record though and tried TiVo for recording programming over our TV antenna before dropping Dish. Much to my surprise TiVo is better than Dish DVR. Easier to find and record shows, even recorded a show that had already happened when I experimented with that. Dish DVR does not even show you past shows, you can only look forward. I highly recommend Roamio
customer_reviews.author: Kodachrome man

customer_reviews.title: Excellent DVR for OTA broadcasts.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to dump satellite but loved the DVR. We did most of our watching from broadcast networks that were recorded on the DVR and were increasingly streaming shows on Amazon and Netflix. We'll miss a few things that were on satellite but we can purchase most of it for streaming if we want. It's really just live sports and if the NBA would stop the stupid blackout policy even that wouldn't be an issue. Otherwise it's easy to use and does what it says and we certainly don't miss our satellite bill.
customer_reviews.author: Pinyon

customer_reviews.title: Vastly improves quality of time spent watching television.
customer_reviews.text: I have come very close to commercial free TV by careful management of the four tuners in this DVR and the Apps provided with it. I find the remote to be easy to learn and very user friendly. Streaming movies has been nearly as seamless as live TV. Set up was a breeze. I'd go for 5 stars, but I find the fonts on the DVR menus to be difficult to read on my 32" screen if I'm more than five to six feet away. Maybe it's time to get a larger screen. The Amazon delivery was flawless as always.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty 1

customer_reviews.title: Almost Right.
customer_reviews.text: I am new to TiVo so there has been a learning curve. I'd give 5 stars except the TiVo subscription rate is too high for my liking. $15/mo. There just isn't a lot of options out there for OTA users. I'd maybe spring for lifetime subscription, but I don't like that it's associated with a tivo serial # and not to an account. UPDATE - Tivo Roamio now supports Amazon prime video, which is great, less devices needed now. I now have a Roku that I don't really use anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Justin N.

customer_reviews.title: charlotte roamio fan
customer_reviews.text: I did not want to continue to pay for two cable boxes. My cable provider is switching to an all digital signal. I realized I could purchase the roamio and avoid the extra cable box rental fee and any additionual dvr rental charges from my cable provider. In the end, I am still spending more money this first year due to the annual TIVO fee. However, I prefer owning the dvr vs. continuing to pay the monthly rental fees. Purchasing the Roamio on Amazon was a better deal (reduced cost). Year two, my overall costs will be less when only paying the TIVO annual fee. Also, should I decide to cut the cord, the roamio can be used OTA.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: I switched from Cable and Satellite!
customer_reviews.text: I am not in a rea that gets more than about six channels, but guess what? I pay $15 for month for whart satellite charged $20 and get the half the programming for free. The rest I get from a content provioder at a 80% discount comnpared to cable/satellite. However, if you are one of those individuals who enjoy watching 20 different shopping channels, movies that you've already seen 3 times, or you just like to aimlessly channel surf, this is not for you (Colorado and Washington might have some takers).
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great all in one system.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my husband a Tivo years ago. He doesn't know computers at all, but has no problem figuring out every feature Tivo offers. He loves the service, the ease of recording, and the ability to pause live tv. His man cave is now just wouldn't be the same without his Tivo. This year for Christmas, I upgraded him to the Roamio and he absolutely loves it. Now he can access Netflix, YouTube and so much more all with one click on the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy N.

customer_reviews.title: Roamio is great. It is my third HD TiVo and by ...
customer_reviews.text: Roamio is great. It is my third HD TiVo and by far the best. I love the remote being RF so you can hide the TiVo inside the media center. But the remote also works for the TV. Best of both worlds! Also installed TiVo Stream and a TiVo mini. Couldn't be happier. Using Antenna now and NO CABLE BILLS!! Sorry Comcast!! But I can go back to cable in the future if they ever develop fair pricing!
customer_reviews.author: Dick Riess

customer_reviews.title: I also love the access to my Netflix
customer_reviews.text: I have cut the cable cord and don't miss it...partly thanks to this little machine. I have a leaf antenna that allows me to get about 36 channels...I would have missed the ability to watch my network shows at my convenience (on demand) if it weren't for my Tivo. I also love the access to my Netflix, Hulu and Amazon accounts. I also have access to youtube and have found interesting shows to replace some I might have watched on cable. THIS is the one you need if you are using an antenna only
customer_reviews.author: E. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: All you need!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually our 3rd TIVO, this one replaces a very undependable Comcast/Xfinity HD receiver that required frequent resets. Already owning two TIVO Premiere units, we knew what to expect, but admit to being disappointed that the Roamio does not support both OTA and Cable via separate tuners.(like the Premiere does). By the way, the Roamio is **very** easy to expand to greater storage capacity with only a simple Hard Drive replacement, literally takes no more than 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: The essential GUIDE function does not work!
customer_reviews.text: The OTA antennae recording feature is excellent for our area. The guide is a total fail! I have contacted TIVO support several times and still have no access to the guide feature which we pay $14 A MONTH for. It is a painstaking process to setup programming when it ALL has to be manually done, essentially ruining some nice features. I will review this again if TIVO support ever responds to my problem.
customer_reviews.author: W. Prentice

customer_reviews.title: I Love Tivo it a great DVR
customer_reviews.text: TiVo is the best DVR out there bar none. This Roamio DVR has all the features that you can want it is the smallest one in size but has four channels that can record and the largest hard drive than my other 4 DVR's which are all TiVo. My only concern is that this new TiVo has no fans in it hope it doesn't overheat so far so good. I have had TiVos for many years with no problems so I would recommend this DVR to anybody who wants a good quality DVR.
customer_reviews.author: dcdave

customer_reviews.title: Snappy box - over the air is great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this basic model to check if over the air TV was as good as my satellite and I was more than impressed. OTA TV is very high quality, my 15 year old antenna in the attic worked just fine, and I cut my satellite cord! My bill went from over $100 a month to $15 a month. In two months I'll have covered the cost of the Roamio box so the rest is gravy! Unlike a lot of streaming of network TV shows, Roamio allows me to fast forward through commercials.
customer_reviews.author: OregonDean

customer_reviews.title: Very good Recording Device.
customer_reviews.text: I do like this TiVo a lot, there are a couple small things that are counter intuitive verses other DVR's I have used before. If I stop playing my recording, it should go back to live TV in the small window. I have pressed the thumbs up for shows before and yet they don't record, so I manually have to go in a set up to record. All in all I do love this machine for over the air. I do not use the netflix etc, because I have all that on amazon fire tv. The combo is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: S. D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: TiVo Roamio is great
customer_reviews.text: I come from the era of 3 TV channels and an antenna, and no such thing as video recording, so having the TiVo makes me feel like a kid in a candy store. My only disappointment was it came without a user manual, so the first couple of days I had to call TiVo tech service a few times to help with using some of the features. I finally found the manual online and saved it on my computer, so now I'm in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. McDermott

customer_reviews.title: Helping me save money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as one of the components to help me get rid of cable and save money. I ended up having to buy a new TV as my old one didn't have the technology to connect with this. No matter. I will still be ahead of the game after about five months of not paying that huge cable bill. This is easy to hook up and understand how to use with my new smart TV. I was concerned about it not being able to stream Amazon Prime, but the TV can do that, so it isn't an issue.
customer_reviews.author: karen m

customer_reviews.title: Best Way to Cut the Cord
customer_reviews.text: I finally decided to cancel Dish after my monthly bill went up to $120 per month. I enjoyed Dish but realized that about 95% of the shows on my DVR came from networks I could receive for free. I could not give up my DVR though. The Tivo Roamio was the perfect solution. I can now record all of my favorite shows for a much smaller monthly fee. I have been very happy with the Tivo and have not missed Dish at all. Having the Netflix app part of the Tivo box is also very convenient. My only complaint is that it does not support Amazon Prime instant videos.
customer_reviews.author: ahousel

customer_reviews.title: Gotta love TIVO!
customer_reviews.text: Nobody does it better than TiVo! Pros - Much faster than previous generations - Wifi Built in - Outstanding Customer Support - Bridging these together is extremely easy! Cons - High cost of subscription plus card rental fees from cable company We bought two of these to replace TWC's AWFUL dvrs. If we had a better provider for cable, we'd probably keep these forever.
customer_reviews.author: DadofTwo

customer_reviews.title: I've missed TiVo :)
customer_reviews.text: I felt that our TiVo Premiere was underpowered (and thus frustrating to use)... so I used a non-TiVO product for the past few years. I read good things about the Roamio and gave TiVo another try and really like this box :) I bought the base model... I wanted 4 over-the-air tuners. The responsiveness is very nice... everything just flows. I didn't have much experience with the new user interface... TiVo has added some very nice stuff (episode guides, multi-service search). The unit is very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Alan L Sibley

customer_reviews.title: Reunited with TiVo
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond happy to have TiVo again. I had it for years but when I switched to Direct TV I was forced to use theirs and it was ot as good. After years of paying for channels I did not watch I decided to become a cord cutter and was happy that this Roamio worked with HD antennas. I am glad to have all the great TiVo features again. Installation is easy and if you ever have questions, TiVo has great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Robbins

customer_reviews.title: The Best DVR's on the Market!!
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend the TIVO DVR's. Highly intuitive, easy setup. I only give 4 out of 5 stars do to the fact that I would like more "CUT THE CABLE" choices other than Netflix, Amazon Prime, VUDU, HULU, YouTube, and MLB. In order to access SLING TV, I had to purchase an Amazon Firestick, which requires me to switch input on my flat screen to access. Also, the quality is not as good as TIVO. Please, Please, Please, work out some type of deal to bring in more "CUT THE CABLE" Apps within TIVO. TIVO DVR;s just makes accessing Apps so seamless.
customer_reviews.author: StrangeQuest

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we wanted
customer_reviews.text: This is our first Tivo box, and we love it. The Roamio is the BEST way to record/watch over-the-air television (CBS, ABC, NBC, PBS, FOX). We chose to pay for the lifetime registration upfront, so we pay $0/month for television. The picture quality of over-the-air television is actually BETTER than cable or satellite, because there is no compression or rebroadcasting taking place. We just put a $75 antenna in the attic, plugged it into the Tivo Roamio, and VOILA!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M.

customer_reviews.title: The "cordcutters'" way out...
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, if you are thinking or have cut the cord... there really is no other choice if you want to pick and choose, record TV shows to watch what you want, when you want, on whatever device you want... period. I gave up DirecTV... and now use TiVo, AppleTV, and Chromcast. I get OTA, Podcasts, Movies and TV Shows. I spend half as much and get 3 to 4 times of what I WANT - WHEN I WANT IT and on WHAT I WANT!!!
customer_reviews.author: This_Old_man_ran_dan

customer_reviews.title: I have been able to reduce my cable bill and still be able to have a great tv experience!
customer_reviews.text: My Tivo journey started because my cable company promotional package ended. My cable bill jumped to $200 a month, and was totally unacceptable to me. The cable company was not willing to work with me in keeping my bill the way it was so I reduced my cable service to its lowest level, and bought a Roamio and Tivo Mini. I've coupled that with a couple of subscription services and have more things that I want to watch now than when I had 3 times more channels. I also now pay about half of what I was paying before.I highly recommend Tivo!
customer_reviews.author: Brad M. Moreau

customer_reviews.title: Why Did I Wait So Long?!?
customer_reviews.text: Am using a DB8E HD antenna near Seattle and this box picked up a lot more stations than connecting it directly to my TV. The Guide options, access to Netflix, Amazon Prime and Hulu and robust recording features make this what cable boxes should be. I had no idea TIVO was so far advanced. I have dumped cable and have access to programs I couldn't get on cable and now get for free. An extra $150 bucks a month not going to cable!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Schleis

customer_reviews.title: I strongly recommend TIVO for tv recording, but
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy my Tivo for recording my favorite tv shows. However, I have to use my fire fly to stream Netflx and all other streaming media, because my Roamio Dvr doesn't have the sensitivity without an Ethernet connection to stream from the master bedroom. Fire fly has very few issues but Roamio goes into bandwidth waits every few minutes. It produces an unacceptable streaming experience due to distance to my VoIP router.
customer_reviews.author: Thurm

customer_reviews.title: Nice to Come Back to TiVo
customer_reviews.text: We had a TiVo interface years ago with a satellite provider's rental DVR. The provider subsequently dropped TiVo and I've missed it for years. We lived in a rural area at the time and didn't have a cable option. We recently moved to a house wired for cable and have our new Roamio hooked up with a cable card. We couldn't be happier. The remote is intuitive and the choices are wonderful. Thank you TiVo for always staying ahead of the curve.
customer_reviews.author: Verified

customer_reviews.title: It's incredibly easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought me my first TV for Mother's Day 2006. I fell in love with it, but TV changed to digital and our device was not compatible. We had the cable company's DVR for a few years and we hated it. We happily went back to TiVo when we ditched cable. A few years late we decided to upgrade to the Roamio with the TiVo mini. There's not a better DVR on the market as far as we are concerned.
customer_reviews.author: ILuvGoldDogs

customer_reviews.title: Great new Tivo Model!
customer_reviews.text: I've had two TIVOs before. This new one is by far the best. I just cut the cord -- no cable and no cable bill. The TIVO does a nice job of aggregating your viewing options -- channel lineup, Netflix, Hulu Plus. When you search for a program or movie the TIVO tells you everywhere it can be found. Added bonus -- I seem to be getting more shows in HD than when I used the cable provider. For example, I now can watch "Mad Men" though Netflix in HD. When I watched on Showtime through cable it was not HD.
customer_reviews.author: R. Newton

customer_reviews.title: It's a Great DVR recorder!
customer_reviews.text: I have had DISH service & DVR for about 15 yrs now, but my bill has gotten so high it's just ridiculous! So I decided to go to antenna TV & the web using the TiVo Roamio DVR. I have been using it about a month now & have found it to be comparable with the Dish DVR & in some ways surpase it. My bill has gone from $110 per month to aprx $35 (this includes the TiVo service for 1 DVR & 1 Mini, plus Hulu Plus & Netflix). I have left Dish & plan on never going back :-)
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic DVR
customer_reviews.text: I recently "cut the cord" with cable. Just to expensive and they keep adding more fees! I have a digital antenna, NetFlix, HULU, and Amazon Prime. I pay about 1/4 of what I was with cable. I can record the sports I like and the awards shows my wife likes. These you can't get on the other services. I pay a Time Warner flat fee on $34.99/ month. (I bought my own modem too because they keep raising the rental fees on that!) TIVO is a great service and provides all the things I use in one place that is intuitive to use and extremely reliable. If you plan to cut the cord, get a TiVo box!
customer_reviews.author: Steven H

customer_reviews.title: Better than my first TiVo
customer_reviews.text: We ditched cable/sat four years ago and haven't looked back. We've been very pleased with our entertainment options through HDR antenna, Netflix, and AmazonPrime. However, one thing we've missed has been the ability to record our favorite shows off network broadcast and PBS. With our TiVo Roamio, we have the complete entertainment package. In fact, my wife exclaimed, "it feels like we have cable!" We love our Roamio!
customer_reviews.author: Brian H Flatter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Machine
customer_reviews.text: This model is so much faster than my Premiere. I am extremely happy with it. My only complaint is when I use my Roamio to browse my recordings on the Premiere, it switches to an old looking SD menu. On the other side when I browse my Roamio from the Premiere you get a nice HD interface. You almost can't even tell you're not looking at the "My Shows" section of the Premiere. It's only a small annoyance though.
customer_reviews.author: B. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect DVR
customer_reviews.text: Cut the cord with your provider. Having this gives you the independence to change your provider at any time since you own what is on the unit and don't have to give it back to the cable company. Anything recorded with one company will still play when you switch to the new one. The one item that I had a gripe about was that this did not support amazon prime but now it does. This is my perfect DVR!
customer_reviews.author: NeilS

customer_reviews.title: My favorite TiVo yet - but I wish I'd had gotten the bigger one!
customer_reviews.text: The new Roamio is smaller, faster, lighter, and easier than ever to use. I have zero complaints - but I'd recommend getting the mid-level model if you think you'll use the streaming features. Totally worth the extra expense, as the entry level model doesn't have the option unless you buy the TiVo Stream for another $100. Upgrading to the mid-level model gets you streaming AND two more tuners. But if you only need 4 tuners and don't need to move content to your iPad, this is the way to go. Amazing price, as well.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: I love my TiVo Roamio
customer_reviews.text: I just discontinued my cable TV which was costing about $100 per month. When I realized that almost all the shows I watched and taped were available on my local TV stations. The only advantage I was receiving from cable was the DVR feature. When I found the TiVo Roamio online, it solved all my recording needs and now I can tape 4 shows at once. Before I was limited to taping only 2 shows at once with the cable DVR. I am so happy that I found TiVo. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: RDS

customer_reviews.title: Love our Roamio!
customer_reviews.text: We love our Roamio. It has worked reliably for us since we bought it (over three years, I believe). It records a ton of programming and also lets us know what shows are available through other services, such as Netflix and Amazon. You can't go wrong with Tivo for convenience. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: GSG

customer_reviews.title: ... satellite TV with over-the-air TV and the TiVo works great for recording shows
customer_reviews.text: We've replaced our satellite TV with over-the-air TV and the TiVo works great for recording shows, being able to rewind a real time show to repeat something we missed or didn't hear clearly, and we can watch our NetFlix through the TiVo. Drawbacks are the rewind for real time show is limited to about 30 minutes back. AND we can't watch Amazon Prime through the TiVo. Amazon if you are reading this, get with TiVo and make it possible to view Amazon Prime through the TiVo, then we can rid of our much older computer that we now have dedicated only use to view Amazon Prime video on our TV.
customer_reviews.author: dianabtx

customer_reviews.title: Great way to beat cable & dish prices
customer_reviews.text: This does everything they do and more. We still haven't explored all the features, but we paid for the Tivo equipment in the first month as our previous bills were skyrocketing. The great thing is we can filter out all those advertising channels and TIVO will find shows we didn't think about or know about by looking for shows like the ones you are already watching. Thanks Tivo - We saved money and have plenty to watch.
customer_reviews.author: dvnmsm

customer_reviews.title: Love having Tivo again!
customer_reviews.text: Finally ditched te time warner DVR boxes, love being back with the "bud-a-boop!" experience again after years without tivo. Wife loves it too, and I'm psyched about the RF remote. I do wish i had spent the extra on the Plus, because it took me 4+ hrs to pull Cat6 cable up through my attic for the Tivo mini in iur MBR, would've been MUCH easier to just use the MOCA feature over coax. But otherwise, love.
customer_reviews.author: J. Webster

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't get it working
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get this setup with TWC, but I ended up not needing it. Plan on having to setup a conference call with TWC and TiVo if it doesn't work. The 'cable' cards TWC gives out are bent and old. I spent several hours on the line with support. I think TWC won because they tired me out and I just didn't want to mess with it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: skyrunr

customer_reviews.title: Beats Charter's crusty, outdated DVR anyday!
customer_reviews.text: Dumped our horrid Charter Cable Motorola DVR that was designed in 1983, I'm certain. It's almost Apple-like in simplicity and function. Are you listening Charter? Motorola? I bit the bullet and bought a lifetime sub, lets hope that Tivo will make good on their promise to not limit the "lifetime" to just the life of the box.
customer_reviews.author: RPC

customer_reviews.title: revolutionized the way to watch live TV.
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered my first tivo 10 years ago and I cannot let go of the service. TiVo has improved and developed their products and services over the years enormously. From a phone line service supplied device to client server smart set top box with plethora of features. The Roamio/Mini addition makes it even easier and cheaper to consume live multi room tv experience.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gustek

customer_reviews.title: No reason to rent a crappy DVR from your cable company when you can upgrade ...
customer_reviews.text: No reason to rent a crappy DVR from your cable company when you can upgrade to the TiVo Roamio. At twelve dollars a month for the DVR and like three dollars for the remote (yes, they charge you rent on the remote) mine paid for itself in no time. I had a TiVo years ago when I was with a satellite company and am so glad I am back to a product that caters to the consumer.
customer_reviews.author: Mystery Trout

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and working flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: We got tired of the ever-increasing DirecTV bill so we decided to cut the cord. We get great OTA signal at our house but we missed having a guide and DVR. Tivo is the perfect answer and it gives us all the great features we missed without the high cost of dish. With the addition of the TiVo Mini we get the great features and service in even more rooms of our house.
customer_reviews.author: Cubby

customer_reviews.title: "TIVO is a DVR for blondes" is our familt joke
customer_reviews.text: My wife, a natural blonde with a Master's degree in Business, was always having trouble with our cable DVR. My solution...a TiVo. So easy to use and program and with a wonderful "skip" feature to avoid commercials. The 20 second jump feature takes a 3 hour football game down to about an hour. It has access to all your favorite TV apps (Netflix, Amazon Prime, HBO, etc.) and delivers 1080p video. My highest recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Gross

customer_reviews.title: Sure Makes Viewing Easier
customer_reviews.text: I love not having to use the terrible comcast cable box. I like most of the TiVo user interface, although they need to update parts of it to HD. I have it grab lots of programs I used to miss, and I watch them when I have time. Wonderful box. I also like that it records all the time, so if you are watching tv and need to get up to take care of something, you can hit pause and return to it when you get back.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Cable Cord Cut
customer_reviews.text: The Roamio TIVO works great, we have a terrific selection of channels with the over the air antenna. Did have to try a couple of antenna installations, in the attic, on the roof, higher on the roof. Higher is better. I miss ESPN sports, but have an extra fifty dollars in my pocket each month. The TIVO unit records up to four programs simultaneously, allows rewinding/instant replay. We love it! We are very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Big Mac

customer_reviews.title: Looking to Ditch Cable
customer_reviews.text: I've been using TiVo Roamio for about a month over the air. I still have my cable. I've been using both systems to see if I can watch everything I want with the Roamio. I love almost everything about the Roamio using the antenna except I can't watch my sports. Comcast has a lock on all my local teams and I can't figure a way around it. My next step is to get the CableCard and test out that experience. I expect to at least save the cost of the equipment rental from Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: swanseri

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sure renting from my cable company would be far ...
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that I didn't see mention that you have to pay $15 per month to use this! Also a lot of hurtles to get it to work with my cable system including over an hour on the phone with my cable company. Once it was working and if the cost to keep it working of $150-180 per year were no big deal I would give it 5 stars. Pretty sure renting from my cable company would be far less costly.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Better than Com with a Cast
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great product but what is the monthly subscription for on a box I already own? The software functionality is great and better than Cable boxes except for the remote. Buttons are not laid out intuitivly and they are not back lit. Font and buttons too small for anybody that doesnt have very young eyes. When used at the same time as a mini tivi I noticed a significant slowdown in function response.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W.

customer_reviews.title: I love my new Tivo
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Tivo Roamio because the last time I switched cable providers and had to return the DVR box I lost some many programs I had recorded especially for the grand kids and they didn't understand why I no longer had their shows. Plus if something is on late night that I want to watch, I record it and watch it the next day. So far it's working great and simple to understand how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn A. Beach

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work because it was still under the previous owners ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work because it was still under the previous owners account and it couldn't be switched without the previous owner cancelling it. It was a real hassle! Do not buy a previously owned TiVo!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Pacitti

customer_reviews.title: TiVo Roamio
customer_reviews.text: Well, I can't think of anything the Roamio doesn't do. It works beautifully with my OTA antenna and TV. I must say that some functions took me a while to figure out and I wish they might have been a bit simpler and the screen a little less cluttered but all in all, I highly recommend this product and would buy it again. Amazon, you know how to pick them!
customer_reviews.author: Just a Horse lover

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I won't repeat all the good things others have already said. I love the fact that I now have free tv via my Leaf antenna, and now I don't have to give up the convenience of a DVR. One of the things that makes the Tivo *way* better than Directv's DVR is the "recently deleted list". If I or another family member delete something by mistake, I can get it back! Love my Tivo Roamio!
customer_reviews.author: Blondie

customer_reviews.title: working great for over 4 years now
customer_reviews.text: i bought 2 one for upstair bedroom and one for downstairs living room. hate paying the rent to our cable provider for theirs. Also used them with just hd antenna and had no problems. when using with cable you have to get a cable card from your provider that was a pain until i called tivo and they knew more about the cards then the cable co. go figure
customer_reviews.author: jtlburn

customer_reviews.title: Good but title is deceiving
customer_reviews.text: Good but title is deceiving. Product works as all the other reviews mention here, BUT this does not come with the Streaming Media adaptor, so don't be disappointed when you open the box even though the title includes that statement. Otherwise, like other Tivo's. Price is $50 cheaper now than just a month ago. Get it while its cheaper and use the money for the streaming adaptor.
customer_reviews.author: Loren
